GridStyle
INotifyPropertyChanged
public
ChartSharp.​GridStyle

Defines the rendering style of a grid in the background of a chart. It is a member of ChartStyle.

Functions
GridStyle
public GridStyle()

Initializes all properties to their default values.

Properties
Background
public Color Background { get; set }

The background color for the grid. More specifically, this is the color for everything between the grid lines.

Default Value

Colors.Transparent

Foreground
public Color Foreground { get; set }

The foreground color of the grid. This is the color of the lines of the grid.

Default Value

Colors.Black

IntervalX
public double IntervalX { get; set }

This interval determines how often lines are drawn in the X-Direction. The lines itself are drawn in the Y-Direction.  If set to 0, LineChart will throw an ArgumentException.

Default Value

1

IntervalY
public double IntervalY { get; set }

This interval determines how often lines are drawn in the Y-Direction. The lines itself are drawn in the X-Direction.  If set to 0, LineChart will throw an ArgumentException.

Default Value

1

IsVisible
public bool IsVisible { get; set }

If true, the grid will be rendered. Otherwise it is not visible

Default Value

true

Thickness
public double Thickness { get; set }

Specifies the thickness of lines of the grid.

Default Value

0.1
